questions.Question: You’re asked to explain the value of AB-730 to a non-technical stakeholder. Which outcome best captures the exam’s focus for business users?

Options.text: Demonstrate practical use of Microsoft 365 Copilot to streamline everyday business workflows and decisions without writing code.
Design custom neural networks and deploy them on Azure Machine Learning using Python.
Build enterprise data lakes and pipelines using Fabric and Synapse.
Configure tenant-wide conditional access and advanced threat protection rules.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: AB-730 validates the ability to apply generative AI—especially Microsoft 365 Copilot—to practical, non-coding business scenarios such as writing, analysis, meetings, and decision support.

questions.Question: A sales manager wants to summarize long email threads and generate follow-up actions after customer meetings. Which Microsoft 365 capability is most directly aligned?

Options.text: Power Platform AI Builder form processing
Microsoft 365 Copilot for Outlook and Teams meeting recap features
Microsoft Purview eDiscovery (Premium)
Azure OpenAI Service with custom fine-tuning

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot in Outlook and Teams generates summaries, suggested replies, action items, and meeting recaps to streamline communication and follow-ups.

questions.Question: Which statement best describes responsible AI expectations for business professionals using Copilot?

Options.text: They must approve all model updates in Azure ML before using Copilot features.
They should apply responsible AI principles such as transparency, privacy, and accountability when prompting and sharing AI-generated content.
They must configure differential privacy parameters in every prompt.
They are responsible for disabling telemetry across the tenant.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Business users are expected to follow responsible AI guidance—e.g., verify outputs, respect privacy, avoid sensitive data in prompts, and attribute sources appropriately.

questions.Question: In Copilot Chat, which prompt is MOST likely to yield a focused, high-quality result when preparing a customer QBR (Quarterly Business Review)?

Options.text: Create a presentation.
Make a deck for our client.
Draft a 6-slide QBR for Contoso covering revenue trends (last 2 quarters), top 3 wins, open risks, and next steps. Use a confident, concise tone and propose two actions per risk.
QBR please.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Effective prompts specify audience, length, scope, tone, required sections, and constraints, which helps Copilot deliver targeted business outputs.

questions.Question: A product marketer wants to research competitor positioning and draft a first-pass blog post in Word. Which Copilot approach is best?

Options.text: Use Copilot in Word to outline sections, ask for competitor highlights, and generate a draft with citations, then fact-check and revise.
Export CRM data to CSV and upload it to Azure OpenAI for auto-publishing.
Ask Copilot in PowerPoint to export notes into a blog without review.
Disable Track Changes and publish any draft Copilot generates to reduce review effort.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot in Word helps plan, generate, and refine content; the user remains responsible for verification, tone, and approvals before publishing.

questions.Question: You need to transform a data table of quarterly sales into insights and a visual for an executive summary. Which workflow is most appropriate?

Options.text: Use Copilot in Excel to analyze trends, ask for key drivers, and generate a chart and a short narrative summary you can reuse in PowerPoint.
Paste the data into Word and manually calculate quarter-over-quarter changes.
Use Teams to tag every stakeholder manually for input.
Email the spreadsheet and request everyone reply-all with observations.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot in Excel can analyze data, surface patterns, produce charts, and generate summaries, accelerating insight creation and reuse across apps.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a primary benefit of Copilot meeting features for project managers?

Options.text: Automatic Gantt chart creation in Project Online
Real-time code reviews during standups
Meeting summaries, decisions, tasks, and follow-up drafts without rewatching the recording
Tenant-wide DLP policy configuration

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot in Teams captures and summarizes key meeting outcomes, action items, and next steps to improve follow-through and save time.

questions.Question: A department lead asks if using Copilot will automatically make content compliant with company retention rules. Is this assumption correct?

Options.text: Yes
No

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot operates within your Microsoft 365 compliance posture, but governance (e.g., retention, DLP) is configured by admins. Users should still follow policy.

questions.Question: You’re coaching a team to iterate on prompts. Which practice is BEST for improving Copilot results?

Options.text: Use a single vague prompt and accept the first output.
Add specific role, context, format, and constraints; then review, critique, and refine the output with follow-up prompts.
Avoid providing examples because they bias the model.
Disable citations to make responses shorter.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Providing role, context, structure, and constraints—and then refining—improves quality. Examples are often helpful; users should still verify facts.

questions.Question: Which scenario best fits the Researcher agent’s role within Microsoft 365 Copilot?

Options.text: Scheduling recurring meetings and sending invites
Aggregating sources, extracting key points, and assembling background material for a proposal
Enforcing legal holds across SharePoint sites
Provisioning user accounts in Entra ID

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: The Researcher agent is designed to gather and synthesize information, helping users build source-informed narratives and backgrounders.

questions.Question: While preparing an executive update deck, you want Copilot in PowerPoint to keep the tone concise and data-driven. Which guidance should you include in the prompt?

Options.text: Ask for a casual tone, long anecdotes, and minimal charts.
Request a concise executive tone, 6–8 slides, one key chart per section, and bullets limited to 5 words.
Let Copilot pick any tone; constraints reduce creativity.
Avoid specifying slide count; ask for 30+ slides to be safe.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Clear instructions on tone, length, visuals, and constraints guide Copilot to produce focused, executive-ready content.

questions.Question: A finance analyst uses Copilot in Excel to detect anomalies in expense data. What is the analyst still responsible for?

Options.text: Validating insights, confirming business context, and deciding actions based on reviewed evidence
Re-training the underlying LLM with corporate data
Creating custom connectors in Fabric
Modifying retention labels in Purview

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Human oversight remains essential—users must verify, contextualize, and decide how to act on AI-generated insights.

questions.Question: Your legal team reminds staff not to paste sensitive customer information into prompts. Which principle does this reinforce?

Options.text: Transparency
Privacy and security
Inclusiveness
Reliability through redundancy

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Responsible AI emphasizes privacy and security. Users should avoid sharing sensitive data in prompts unless policy allows and controls are in place.

questions.Question: You need to roll out Copilot usage norms for a marketing department. Which two elements should the guidance prioritize? (Choose TWO.)

Options.text: How to write role-aware prompts with target audience, tone, and brand guidelines
Mandatory fine-tuning of the base model for each campaign
Verification steps: fact-checking, source attribution, and legal review before publishing
Blocking Copilot for email to reduce volume

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Quality prompting plus governance (review and attribution) elevates output quality while mitigating risk; fine-tuning is unnecessary for routine business tasks.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A regional operations team must produce a weekly status report spanning supply delays, cost impacts, and mitigation plans. They want to standardize content quality and shorten the cycle. What’s the best end-to-end approach?

Options.text: Use Copilot in Word with a templated prompt that requests sections (delays, costs, mitigations), import highlights from Teams meeting recaps, and generate an executive summary.
Collect updates via reply-all and paste into a long email for leadership.
Create a 40-slide deck every week regardless of change.
Use PowerPoint only; visuals alone remove the need for analysis.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: A structured prompt and template in Word, plus reuse of Teams recaps, standardizes inputs and accelerates consistent reporting with an executive-ready summary.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: HR must draft inclusive job descriptions faster while reducing bias risk. Which Copilot practice helps most?

Options.text: Prompt Copilot to analyze language for inclusiveness and neutrality, propose alternatives, and cite rationale before HR final review.
Ask Copilot to auto-post roles without review to save time.
Disable track changes to avoid feedback loops.
Use Copilot only for formatting final PDFs.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot can suggest inclusive language and highlight potential biases, but HR must review and approve before publishing.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A customer success leader wants a client health briefing that pulls from recent emails, meetings, and a spreadsheet of usage metrics. What should they do first?

Options.text: Use Copilot Chat to summarize communications and ask Copilot in Excel to analyze usage trends; then combine the outputs into a briefing in Word or PowerPoint.
Export everything to a third-party LLM without any review.
Send a mass survey to all clients and wait for responses.
Create a static PDF and avoid updates.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot across Outlook/Teams and Excel enables quick synthesis of communications and metrics; assembling into a briefing completes the workflow.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: The CIO asks if Copilot will access only the data a user can already see in Microsoft 365. As a business lead, how should you respond?

Options.text: Yes—Copilot respects existing Microsoft 365 permissions and only surfaces what the signed-in user can access.
No—Copilot reads all tenant data regardless of permissions.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot adheres to Microsoft 365 permissions and context; it does not override access controls.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A VP wants a one-page executive brief from a 40-page market report and three internal memos. Which Copilot pattern is best?

Options.text: Ask Copilot Chat to extract top 5 trends with supporting bullets, contradictions, and open questions; then generate a one-page brief in Word.
Paste all 40 pages into an email and ask for comments.
Create a Teams channel and upload without instructions.
Ask for a 50-page expansion of the content.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Focused extraction plus a structured brief request yields an executive-ready summary with traceable rationale.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A field sales team wants to generate tailored follow-up emails after demos. Which guidance will most improve Copilot output quality?

Options.text: Provide the buyer persona, pain points discussed, desired CTA, and a concise tone; ask Copilot to include 3 bulleted benefits linked to the demo.
Ask Copilot to write a long generic email for all prospects.
Remove any constraints to let Copilot be creative.
Avoid specifying the CTA to keep it neutral.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Role, context, tone, and structure yield targeted follow-ups; CTAs and benefits improve clarity and actionability.

questions.Question: Which is a best practice for using Copilot when discussing regulated content?

Options.text: Bypass internal review because Copilot cites sources.
Follow organizational compliance policies, avoid sensitive data in prompts unless permitted, and route final content for required approvals.
Share client PII in prompts to get personalized outputs.
Disable all labels to reduce friction.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Users must align with compliance rules and protect sensitive data; approvals remain mandatory for regulated materials.

questions.Question: Which Copilot feature pairing is MOST suitable for building a client proposal faster?

Options.text: Outlook’s sweep rules + calendar sharing
Word drafting with Researcher agent for sources and PowerPoint generation for the client-facing deck
Teams emojis + GIF reactions
Excel pivot tables only

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Use Copilot in Word to research and draft, then generate a tailored presentation in PowerPoint for client delivery.

questions.Question: Your team wants to standardize prompts for recurring work (e.g., weekly updates). What is the intended value of creating and managing such prompt patterns?

Options.text: They guarantee perfect answers every time.
They reduce variability, accelerate production, and promote consistency while still requiring human review.
They eliminate the need for any subject-matter expertise.
They replace retention and labeling policies.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Reusable prompt patterns speed up work and improve consistency but do not remove human accountability or governance needs.

questions.Question: Which Copilot capability best helps a business analyst convert raw metrics into a narrative for executives?

Options.text: Copilot in Excel to identify trends and then generate a concise text summary suitable for use in a Word brief
Manual transcription of tables into email
Posting screenshots without commentary in Teams
Copying numbers into PowerPoint without context

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot can analyze and summarize data, producing narratives that translate metrics into executive insights.

questions.Question: A team wants to use Copilot to draft a policy memo and ensure all statements are evidence-based. What should they include in the prompt?

Options.text: Request citations to source documents and ask Copilot to flag assumptions or missing evidence for follow-up.
Ask Copilot to remove references to keep it brief.
Request only bullet points and no links to sources.
Instruct Copilot to approve the memo automatically.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Requesting citations and gaps enables traceability and targeted follow-up before publishing.

questions.Question: YES/NO: Is Copilot intended to replace human judgment for critical business decisions?

Options.text: Yes
No

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot augments human work; users remain accountable for verification, judgment, and approvals.

questions.Question: Which two elements make a prompt more effective for a customer escalation response? (Choose TWO.)

Options.text: Customer context (issue summary, impact, desired outcome)
Tone and length guidance (e.g., empathetic, under 150 words)
Intentionally vague instructions to allow creativity
Requests to omit any supporting details

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Context plus tone/length constraints guide Copilot to produce targeted, empathetic, on-brief responses.

questions.Question: Which Teams capability with Copilot is most helpful for absent stakeholders who need the gist of a meeting?

Options.text: Automatic meeting recap with summary, decisions, and action items
Manual timestamping of every discussion point by the organizer
Forbidding recordings to reduce storage
Disabling chat during meetings

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Meeting recap condenses the discussion into actionable highlights for quick catch-up.

questions.Question: Which statement is accurate regarding data access and Copilot across Microsoft 365?

Options.text: Copilot exposes all tenant content to everyone by default.
Copilot honors existing file, site, and mailbox permissions and surfaces results within that access scope.
Copilot requires global admin rights for all users.
Copilot can bypass sensitivity labels at runtime.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot respects Microsoft 365 permissions and sensitivity configuration; it does not grant broader access than the user already has.

questions.Question: A marketing team wants a fresh slide design from a written brief. Which flow is best?

Options.text: Draft a concise narrative in Word with key messages and ask Copilot in PowerPoint to generate slides with a clean design; then edit.
Paste raw spreadsheets into slides without headers.
Use Teams to send emojis and ask others to design.
Export to PDF first, then retype into PowerPoint.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot can transform structured narrative inputs into slide frameworks that can be refined visually.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: You lead change management for a Copilot rollout. Which action best drives adoption and responsible use?

Options.text: Publish role-based prompt libraries with examples, set expectations for verification, and run office-hours for Q&A.
Disable Copilot after 30 days to measure impact.
Announce once via email and consider the program complete.
Avoid training to prevent bias in usage patterns.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Adoption improves with curated examples, clear norms, and ongoing support channels.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A finance VP asks for a quick variance analysis with commentary for a board pack. Which Copilot sequence is best?

Options.text: Analyze variances in Excel with Copilot, ask for key drivers and risks, and export the commentary to Word for the board narrative.
Screenshot the spreadsheet and email it without context.
Create a 50-page appendix of raw tables.
Ask Copilot in PowerPoint to remove all numbers and keep only images.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Excel + Copilot is ideal for analysis and commentary; Word consolidates the final board narrative.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: Customer support wants to turn a troubleshooting guide into a short internal FAQ quickly. What should they ask Copilot to do?

Options.text: Extract top issues and convert steps into Q&A format, 1–2 sentences per answer, with links to the detailed guide.
Hide all links to avoid distractions.
Rewrite everything as a long essay.
Publish without SME review.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Targeted extraction and formatting accelerate knowledge reuse; SME review remains essential.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A program lead wants Copilot to monitor a channel and summarize blockers daily. Which practice helps most?

Options.text: Define the reporting cadence, scope (e.g., blockers and owners), and the output format (bulleted list with dates) in the prompt.
Avoid specifying a schedule so results vary.
Include confidential passwords to improve accuracy.
Request only emojis for brevity.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Clear scope, cadence, and structure make automated summaries more actionable and consistent.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A bid team must produce a proposal and wants to differentiate tone by audience (executives vs. technical evaluators). How can Copilot help?

Options.text: Generate two versions: a concise executive summary and a detailed technical appendix; specify audience, tone, and length in prompts.
Create one generic document for all audiences.
Only provide images to save time.
Exclude any constraints so Copilot decides the tone.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Audience-aware prompting enables tailored outputs appropriate to executive vs. technical reviewers.

questions.Question: Which Copilot behavior should users expect regarding hallucinations and factual accuracy?

Options.text: Copilot never makes mistakes if you ask nicely.
Users must review, fact-check, and request citations; Copilot can err, so human validation is required.
Copilot auto-corrects facts at publish time.
Accuracy is guaranteed if prompts are short.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Human oversight is essential; requesting citations and verifying claims reduces risk from hallucinations.

questions.Question: A team wants to track decisions and owners from weekly meetings. Which Copilot-enabled approach is best?

Options.text: Use Teams meeting recap to extract decisions and action items with owners and due dates, and summarize into a weekly status note.
Rely on memory and rebuild notes monthly.
Disable recordings and avoid any notes.
Send a blank document after each meeting.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Meeting recap focuses on outcomes and actions, enabling consistent tracking.

questions.Question: What’s the best way to minimize bias and improve inclusivity in AI-assisted content?

Options.text: Ask Copilot to scan for biased terms and suggest inclusive alternatives; include a review checklist.
Trust Copilot blindly because it is unbiased.
Disable inclusive language checks.
Avoid any human review to stay neutral.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Prompting for bias checks plus human review helps align with inclusivity goals.

questions.Question: YES/NO: Should users rely on Copilot alone to interpret sensitive legal clauses without consulting legal counsel?

Options.text: Yes
No

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Legal content should be reviewed by qualified counsel; Copilot can assist with summaries but not replace expert judgment.

questions.Question: A PM needs a RACI view from a long project plan. Which Copilot instruction is most effective?

Options.text: “Create a RACI matrix from the attached plan; list tasks as rows and roles as columns with clear R/A/C/I tags, then summarize top 5 ownership risks.”
“Make it better.”
“Write a poem about the plan.”
“Remove all owner names to protect privacy.”

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Specific output format (RACI), inputs, and risk summary produce an actionable artifact.

questions.Question: Which pairing correctly matches Copilot app and typical value?

Options.text: Word → Draft and refine long-form content with citations
Excel → Compose orchestral scores automatically
Outlook → Configure tenant retention labels
Teams → Create VM images for developers

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot in Word assists with structured drafting and refinement; the other options are unrelated.

questions.Question: Which practice best supports transparency when publishing AI-assisted reports?

Options.text: Note that AI tools aided drafting, include citations, and document assumptions and limitations.
Hide all sources to appear authoritative.
Claim no human was involved to increase trust.
Avoid disclosing any AI usage to keep it simple.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Transparency includes acknowledging AI assistance, citing sources, and clarifying assumptions.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: An HR partner needs a balanced performance summary from manager notes and peer feedback. What should the Copilot prompt include?

Options.text: Requested structure (strengths, opportunities, examples), neutral tone, and 200-word limit; flag ambiguous evidence.
Ask Copilot to use superlatives only.
Exclude examples to save space.
Publish without employee review.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Structure, tone, length, and requests for flags help ensure fairness and clarity.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: The communications team wants a press release draft and a matching social post. Which cross-app flow is best?

Options.text: Draft the press release in Word with Copilot and request a 100-word social version with 3 key hashtags; review and route for approvals.
Only write the social post; skip the press release.
Ask Copilot to publish externally without review.
Avoid any length constraints to preserve creativity.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Creating a long-form piece and its social variant with constraints supports omnichannel consistency and approvals.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: The COO requests a weekly operational dashboard narrative. Which Copilot practice adds the MOST value?

Options.text: Ask for outlier detection, driver analysis, and a risk/mitigation table with owners; limit to 150 words.
Include all charts without commentary.
Omit owner names to reduce accountability.
Avoid highlighting risks to maintain positivity.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Directed analysis plus a structured risk view yields concise, actionable leadership insights.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A sales enablement lead wants a skills-playbook from top reps’ notes and call summaries. What should they request from Copilot?

Options.text: Synthesize patterns into a playbook with scenarios, messaging, objection handling, and do/don’t lists; include anonymized examples.
Copy raw notes verbatim into a long appendix only.
Delete all examples to save space.
Publish without legal review of customer references.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Pattern synthesis with structured sections and examples creates a reusable, high-value playbook.

questions.Question: Which pairing is most accurate for Copilot agents in business workflows?

Options.text: Researcher agent → gather and synthesize sources; Analyst agent → explore data for insights
Researcher agent → configure retention labels; Analyst agent → create user accounts
Researcher agent → reimage devices; Analyst agent → manage Wi-Fi
Researcher agent → schedule meetings; Analyst agent → file legal holds

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Researcher focuses on sourcing and synthesis; Analyst focuses on data-driven insighting.

questions.Question: Which is an example of an effective constraint to improve Copilot output for executives?

Options.text: “Keep to 120 words, highlight 3 KPIs, and propose 2 actions with owners.”
“Write as much as possible.”
“Avoid any structure.”
“Exclude all numbers for readability.”

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Concise length, KPI focus, and action owners guide executive-ready outputs.

questions.Question: YES/NO: Is it acceptable to publish AI-generated content externally without human review if Copilot included citations?

Options.text: Yes
No

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Human review is required to validate accuracy, tone, and compliance—even when citations are present.

questions.Question: Which is the best way to direct Copilot to compare two product proposals?

Options.text: “Compare proposals A and B by cost, timeline, risks, and benefits. Create a 4-row table and conclude with a recommendation and 2 assumptions.”
“Which is better?”
“Rewrite both proposals instead of comparing.”
“Ignore risks to keep it positive.”

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Clear criteria, format, and a requested recommendation produce focused decision support.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A product manager needs a customer interview guide. What prompt is most effective?

Options.text: “Create a 10-question interview guide for enterprise IT buyers evaluating SaaS security; include open-ended questions and a consent reminder.”
“Write questions.”
“Only yes/no questions.”
“Skip consent to reduce friction.”

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Audience, topic, length, and ethical reminders yield a usable interview guide.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: The CFO wants a sensitivity analysis on pricing using last quarter’s data. Which Copilot flow is best?

Options.text: Use Copilot in Excel to model price changes vs. revenue and margin, visualize outcomes, and summarize implications for leadership.
Manually re-enter data into Word.
Send the spreadsheet without commentary.
Only produce a static pie chart.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Excel with Copilot supports scenario modeling, visualization, and executive summaries.

questions.Question: SCENARIO: A PMO wants to reduce status churn. Which approach aligns with Copilot’s strengths?

Options.text: Create a standard status template and prompt Copilot to populate it from meeting recaps, email threads, and tracker data; then review.
Collect updates ad hoc in chat without structure.
Publish any AI output immediately.
Avoid templates to keep it flexible.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Templates + Copilot reduce variance and time-to-complete; human review remains essential.

questions.Question: Which statement best reflects AB-730’s audience and scope?

Options.text: Designed for developers building ML models in Python.
Designed for business professionals using generative AI in Microsoft 365 to enhance productivity and outcomes.
Focused on Azure infrastructure deployment.
Focused on Dynamics 365 ERP configuration only.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: AB-730 targets business users leveraging Copilot and gen AI across common Microsoft 365 workflows.

questions.Question: Which two are appropriate governance reminders for AI-assisted content? (Choose TWO.)

Options.text: Respect sensitivity labels and avoid disclosing confidential data in prompts unless policy allows.
Publish drafts without review to speed time-to-market.
Attribute sources where required and document assumptions.
Ignore mandatory approvals if Copilot provided citations.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Data handling and transparent attribution are core governance expectations; approvals remain mandatory.

questions.Question: Which Copilot instruction most helps a recruiter prepare for an intake meeting with a hiring manager?

Options.text: “Summarize role requirements from these notes, list top 5 must-have competencies, and propose 8 targeted interview questions.”
“Write a generic job post with no details.”
“Only produce a long narrative.”

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Structured extraction plus targeted questions accelerates preparation and alignment.

questions.Question: YES/NO: Should users store personal passwords inside prompts to help Copilot access systems?

Options.text: Yes
No

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Never include passwords or secrets in prompts; follow security best practices.

questions.Question: Which instruction best helps Copilot write a customer case study?

Options.text: “Draft a 400-word case study for Contoso (industry: retail) with problem, solution, outcomes (3 metrics), and a customer quote placeholder; neutral, professional tone.”
“Write something long.”
“Make it funny and vague.”
“Exclude outcomes.”

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Audience, structure, outcomes, length, and tone constraints yield a usable case study draft.

questions.Question: Multiple-answer: Which two activities are well-suited for Copilot in Excel during a quarterly business review? (Choose TWO.)

Options.text: Detecting trends and outliers across regions
Applying legal holds to mailboxes
Generating a narrative summary of KPI movements
Creating new Entra ID users

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Trend/outlier detection and narrative summaries align to Copilot in Excel capabilities; the other options are administrative tasks outside Excel.

questions.Question: You must brief executives on AI adoption progress. Which Copilot request is best?

Options.text: “Create a one-page executive summary of Copilot adoption with usage metrics, top 3 wins, 3 risks with mitigations, and next 2 actions.”
“Write everything you can about AI.”
“Remove risks to keep the tone positive.”
“Only include screenshots.”

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Clear structure, metrics, risks/mitigations, and next actions produce an executive-ready brief aligned to leadership needs.
